section.title: Introduction
section.p: Mingle lets your project team view a complete history of all changes made to a card, and any murmurs made against that card.
section.hint: You can view a complete history of all changes made to a project (or to specific card types, wiki pages or revisions) by clicking the main History tab. You can even subscribe via feeds or email to stay up-to-date with any relevant project changes.
section.p: You can view a card's history and murmurs in the top right corner of the screen when viewing a card.
By default, all murmurs for a card show first with a blank space to add a new murmur.
Click the History component to display card history.
Click the View link next to a card version to see the card's status at that version.
And click the Show latest link to return to the current version.

section.title: Card history
section.p: Mingle creates an entry against card history and revises the card version number each time somebody makes a change to a card. Whenever there's a change to a card Mingle creates a snapshot of the previous version, so you can view the state of a card at any stage throughout its lifecycle.

bullets.title: You may want to view previous versions of a card page if:
bullets.item: you or a team member accidentally overwrote a card's content
you want to view information captured at an earlier stage of your project
you remembered that there was some useful information or attachment in a previous version of a card.

bullets.title: For each card's historical version, Mingle shows:
bullets.item: who updated the card and when (relative to your current time)
a summary of the changes made for each version
a link to view a previous card version.

bullets.title: Mingle updates card history whenever you or a team member:
bullets.item: creates or imports a new card (version 1)
commits source code and includes the card number in the commit message
changes a card as part of a bulk update

updates a card property (from either opening the card, or dragging it to another property value within the Grid view). If you change more than one property, Mingle creates more than one history entry/card version)
imports an updated version of the card.

section.hint: You can use card transitions to update multiple card properties at once. Clicking a transition link only updates a card's history once - regardless of how many card properties it updates.

section.title: Card murmurs
section.hint: Murmurs aren't designed as a substitute for talking to your teammates. Their main purpose is to contribute collective knowledge about the development process and project progress.
section.p: Card murmurs are a way to discuss and explain team actions and decisions relating to cards. For example, murmurs can explain reasons why a developer fixed a bug a certain way, or provide clarification to a developer implementing a user story.
You can add card murmurs whenever you open a card because the murmurs field is open and ready for you to type by default.
